blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

tags: to get me thru the long night
summary:
Baelor
Game of Thrones S1E9 rewatch (In which shit gets real)
This show is so fucking boss. Books aside, what show has the balls...
body:
Baelor

Game of Thrones S1E9 rewatch (In which shit gets real)

  • This show is so fucking boss. Books aside, what show has the balls to kill off its main character and the heretofore most famous cast member, nine goddamn episodes in?
  • Of course we didn’t know at the time that the main characters are actually our two Dragon teens, who are having all the angst and turmoil this episode.
  • First scene is Varys trying to reason with Ned, and Ned being all “But my HONOR.” What is this shit, Karate Kid 2? Sweep the leg, Ned Stark, shit.
  • And then he confesses to some bullshit anyway
  • Does anyone think it makes Ned throw up in his mouth a little when he says Stannis is the rightful heir, when he knows Aegon Motherfucking Targaryen, the true heir, is kicking it at The Wall?
  • Speaking of Egg #2, this ep starts out OK for him. He’s got his burnt hand bandaged, and he gets a sweet new sword.
  • And then his fun parade gets rained on when he finds out that Robb had marched to war, and he throws himself a pity party. Luckily, the OG Maester Uncle Aemon is there, again, to stick a boot up his broody ass like, “Yo, kid, you don’t even know the shit that’s gone down in my life.”
  • And Jon finds out that Maester Aemon is a Targ, and looks at him like he’s seen a literal dragon, and it. Is. Awesome and Priceless
  • But the whole Love is the death of duty speech….Those words are gonna come around on Aegon in Season 8, it is known. This is one of my favorite scenes of the entire fucking series and it gives me so many feels.
  • Dany is having a bad day. Drogo’s wound has festered, and he falls from his horse. Then his blood riders get all, “Can I talk to the man of the house?” And she’s like “I’m the Khaleesi, muthafucka, take your patriarchy elsewhere.”
  • Dany pays the price. Only death can pay for life. If this is revisited in Season 8 and has anyfuckingthing to do with Jon or Boat Baby, I will lose. My. Shit. She’s already shown she’ll turn to desperate measures to try to save her man, with disastrous results. Let us cast a shield of protection around Boat Baby, NOW.
  • Catelyn Stark is marginally less awful in this episode. She starts to show she’s not a complete and total waste of space by negotiating with Mr. Filch Walder Frey to get Robb across that stupid bridge, and she is one proud mama wolf Robb returns from battle
  • Speaking of Robb, he’s delicious and I miss him, and he’s good at this shit.
  • We meet Shae in this episode and learn some of Tyrion’s backstory. I forgot how cheeky Shae was.
  • Bronn is the GOAT.
  • That last scene. That last fucking scene, when the PS4 spokesman finds Arya and stops her from watching Ned’s execution. The last shot with the birds flying away rather than Ned’s head rolling around on the ground is so poignant, and I’m sure some meta person will also explain the symbolism around it, but really I think it just subverts our expectations by showing us that even in the midst of great violence and personal tragedy, the world around us keeps going on as normal. Well done, GOT.

blog.name: incorrectstarkfamily
blog.title: written by grrm himself, probably
blog.description: Ned, Catelyn, Robb, Talisa, Theon, Jon, Sansa, Bran, Arya, and Rickon, with guest appearances.

summary:
Arya: I have a plan. It might get us both killed, but if it works it'll be a totally boss story. Cool?

Jon: No! It's not...
body:
Arya: I have a plan. It might get us both killed, but if it works it’ll be a totally boss story. Cool?

Jon: No! It’s not cool!

Arya: Cool.

Jon: No, I said it’s not cool!!

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: The Northern Lords on the show are useless whiny idiotic shitheads
When will we see the bad-ass lords from the books?
summary:
At the end of the day, when Jon goes back to the North, the
people who truly respect and love him will be on his side and...
body:
At the end of the day, when Jon goes back to the North, the people who truly respect and love him will be on his side and understand that he made the right decision. These people include:

Arya, who was ready to chop off some heads because the lords were insulting Jon and talking treason.

Bran, who truly understands the gravity of the threat and what’s needed to defeat the WW.

The Wildlings who have fought and died for Jon and are loyal to him.

Lyanna Mormont who gave her 62 men to fight in the BOTB because her father thought Jon was the best man to fight the WW

Anyone else? If the likes of Glover - treasonous weather vanes - want to kick Jon out because he bend the knee, they can come up with their own way to defeat the WW. Glover had no issues with the Boltons as wardens of the North answering to the Lannisters of KL. But suddenly, when Dany comes to save them, Northern independence would be more important than an apocalyptic threat?

If they start talking bs, Jon should let them make Sansa QITN, ask them to deal with the WW on their own and peace out with Dany, Arya, Bran and Ghost. But he’s too good for that. So we will have to once again sit through Jon tiredly dealing with a bunch of naysayers shitting all over his plans.

It’s also hilarious how rabid Stark/Sansa fans go on and on about Northern independence and Dany not respecting their rights. They should ask Theon Greyjoy about how he felt being a child hostage in Winterfell because his father wanted independence for the Iron Islands. So it’s all okay for Ned Stark to attack the Iron Islands because they dared to fight for independence, but everyone should respect the North’s right to independence? This hypocrisy and double standards are what is typical of the Stark fandom. It’s one rule for the Starks and another for everyone else.

Hopefully Northern shitheads like Glover have enough brain cells to realize that they need Dany’s help and band together to defeat the common threat rather than bitch and whine about Jon doing the needful.

blog.name: marta-elentari
blog.title: Varda Elentarí
blog.description: Marta | She/Her | 21 | Med student | 🇷🇴 | Orthodox Christian | Hetero-demisexual, but gay for Varda Elentari | Ask box open I Major Tolkien fan, meaning that I post/reblog anything L0TR and Silmarillion related | Love AS0IAF too (but totally anti Game of Clowns) | Melkor & Varda specialist | In this house, we also stan Tywin Lannister (and our lord and saviour Charles Dance), Joanna Lannister and Daenerys Targaryen | Therefore I am 50% Lann 50% Targ | If you like Sansa Stark, this is not the place for you | Melkor & Varda and Tywin & Joanna are my OTPs | I paint and I write metas | I love making edits as well | Shitposting will go ever on and on on this page | I also post/discuss/reblog things about other fantasy series I like, such as Harry Potter, Witcher, Wheel of Time and Kingkiller Chronicle | Sideblog: @star-crossedvoyager (mostly for anti sjm posts) | You can find me on insta: @martaaaisabella (my personal account); @martaaa1506 (for Tolkien stuff and anti SJM shitposts)

blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced

summary: ever since the show came out and showed that jon was a legitimate targaryen. the response has always rubbed me the wrong way....
question: ever since the show came out and showed that jon was a legitimate targaryen. the response has always rubbed me the wrong way. “jon snow is not a bastard afterall! he’s the heir to the iron throne”. and for jon just to forget his bastard upbringing and be a targaryen king feels wrong to me? from what i gathered about his character, being a legitimate child isn’t something he wants. it is ultimately to belong and be a stark. i just want to know your thoughts on this?
answer:
There is no forgetting that Jon Snow, regardless of whether his parents were married or not, regardless of how high he rises in life, was raised the Bastard of Winterfell.

Jon is deeply uncomfortable with his bastardy and I believe he does want legitimacy, if only to escape said bastardy. I mean, this is a big moment in his first chapter:

[Benjen] put a hand on Jon’s shoulder. “Come back to me after you’ve fathered a few bastards of your own, and we’ll see how you feel.”

Jon trembled. “I will never father a bastard,” he said carefully. “Never!” He spat it out like venom.

- Jon I, AGoT

That’s in response to his request to join the Watch, a request in turn based on the fact that he doesn’t feel he has a future.

Robb would someday inherit Winterfell, would command great armies as the Warden of the North. Bran and Rickon would be Robb’s bannermen and rule holdfasts in his name. His sisters Arya and Sansa would marry the heirs of other great houses and go south as mistress of castles of their own. But what place could a bastard hope to earn?

His position has deeply influenced his relationship with his siblings. He bonds with Arya because of their shared feelings of being outsiders in the family. Even though he loves Sansa, her refusal to call him anything but her half brother stings. And Robb -

Jon was still not certain how he felt about it. Robb a king? The brother he’d played with, fought with, shared his first cup of wine with? But not mother’s milk, no. So now Robb will sip summerwine from jeweled goblets, while I’m kneeling beside some stream sucking snowmelt from cupped hands.

- Jon I, ACoK

Jon loves Robb and is loyal to him. He’s also jealous of Robb and the position his birth gives him. This is one of the aspects of the book that hasn’t come across so clearly in the show. What resentment Jon feels for Robb is inextricably bound up with the position Robb has as Ned’s heir and, later, the King in the North. If Jon ever becomes King in the North in the books, the issue of “this should have been Robb’s” is something I’d expect to see again and again in Jon’s internal narration. I mean, when he’s pondering the prospect in the books…

You can’t be Lord of Winterfell, you’re bastard-born, he heard Robb say again. And the stone kings were growling at him with granite tongues. You do not belong here. This is not your place.

- Jon XII, ASoS

The stone kings are a reference to Jon’s recurring dreams of the Stark crypts, and whether those dreams are a manifestation of Jon’s feelings of not belonging due to his bastardy or a mystical hint towards his biological parentage is not clear. But this is a source of grief to Jon, rather than a prompt towards seeking out an alternate heritage.

Like I said. There’s no forgetting this. Jon’s bastardy, his unease with it, the peace he makes with it, the distance it puts between him and the people he loves, these are cornerstones of his character.

summary: A Revelation [tags: Jon/Daenerys, Regency AU, aunt/nephew relationship, scandal]  “And you’ve met your aunt, of course,” the man...
body:
A Revelation

[tags: Jon/Daenerys, Regency AU, aunt/nephew relationship, scandal]

“And you’ve met your aunt, of course,” the man with the thinning hair whose name Jon forgets says, as he steers him by the shoulder through the heaving room of the ball his father has organised on his behalf, to introduce his son to the ton now that it has been announced that Jon Targaryen is miraculously a bastard no longer.

“My aunt—” Jon says dizzily, thinking of all the guests he has met this evening, their overwhelming attentions, their eagerness for his favour, and how not half an hour ago he fled, overwhelmed, to the Orangery for some quiet and happened to chance upon a remarkable woman—

“Yes,” the man says, halting Jon in front of the very same woman who had been in the Orangery, the one with whom he had had such a luminous conversation, a woman so beautiful, so singular in her elegance and passion, even from such a brief conversation, that he had been determined to discover whether or not she was yet betrothed.

“Pardon?” Jon says, his mind utterly unable to grasp the situation before him.

[read more]

blog.name: fangirlfish
blog.title: A Blog of a Speculative Fish
blog.description: Commentary on fandoms of interest. My Primary tumblr is @elew223

title: NYCC - Day 2 Report
body:
Just like the day before I didn’t really need to get up too early as my first event of the day wasn’t until about 11:30. So as long as I was physically inside the convention center, by around 11am, I was good to go. I just barely made it as I had missed a train and had to wait five minutes for the next train. Then I had to wait a few minutes for the 7 train to get me all the way to the convention center. Anyways I just managed to get inside in time for a SPECIAL thing that I only decided to do about a week before the con…

Why yes… I did pay money to take a picture with David Tennant. Was it expensive? Yes it was. Was it worth the money? I like to think so. The chances that i’ll ever be within feet of him ever again is very low, so why not do it? I shared the picture with a few people, but I’m not planning on posting it on here. Anyways, it was a brief moment and I was only around him long enough to take the picture and say good morning to him. Still it was a cool moment that I’ll remember. Taking a picture with my favorite Doctor.

So the first proper panel of the day was the 12:15 Building Your Own Themyscira. It was an interesting panel talking about about how to build social networks in various industries. It was very encouraging. I also discovered Geek Girl Brunch. I never knew this was a thing, but now that I do I’m VERY seriously thinking about joining the NYC chapter. I mean seriously.. if anyone reading this identifies as female, you might want to consider joining if there is a chapter where you live. It would be kind of meeting up with other fellow nerdy females for some fun activities and hanging out.

After that, I decided to go back to that vendor I discovered the day before to buy my Jon Snow Pops. The line to buy the Pops was very confusing and long. It was confusing because I had to ask a couple times to figure where the end of the line was. It was so long and the Exhibitors Hall was so crowded, the purchase line had to be cut up into 3 segments to allow crowds to pass through the aisles! I had to wait probably about 15 minutes before I got to the counter and told the people at the counter which ones I wanted. I was so happy I got my Jons. As I posted the pictures on another post, they have joined their brother and the other Stark pops here at home. Hm… I should find time and do a family reunion picture of the Pops. Now I just need an Iron Throne…

My day was ending early as the only other panel of interest to me per schedule was the 4:00pm Kodansha Comics panel. It’s always fun to sit in on the panel listening in on what interesting manga title they just finished releasing and what stuff is coming out in the next few months that might be of interest. I sat on the panel last year and happily discovered a couple titles that are really great reads that I would recommend. There are a couple titles that sounded promising, but if I actually read them I’ll mention them on here in the future as they haven’t been published in English yet.

At any rate, it was just as well I ended my second day at the con kind of early given the VERY long day ahead of me the next day…

Why yes… I did pay money to take a picture with David Tennant. Was it expensive? Yes it was. Was it worth the money? I like to think so. The chances that i’ll ever be within feet of him ever again is very low, so why not do it? I shared the picture with a few people, but I’m not planning on posting it on here. Anyways, it was a brief moment and I was only around him long enough to take the picture and say good morning to him. Still it was a cool moment that I’ll remember. Taking a picture with my favorite Doctor.

So the first proper panel of the day was the 12:15 Building Your Own Themyscira. It was an interesting panel talking about about how to build social networks in various industries. It was very encouraging. I also discovered Geek Girl Brunch. I never knew this was a thing, but now that I do I’m VERY seriously thinking about joining the NYC chapter. I mean seriously.. if anyone reading this identifies as female, you might want to consider joining if there is a chapter where you live. It would be kind of meeting up with other fellow nerdy females for some fun activities and hanging out.

After that, I decided to go back to that vendor I discovered the day before to buy my Jon Snow Pops. The line to buy the Pops was very confusing and long. It was confusing because I had to ask a couple times to figure where the end of the line was. It was so long and the Exhibitors Hall was so crowded, the purchase line had to be cut up into 3 segments to allow crowds to pass through the aisles! I had to wait probably about 15 minutes before I got to the counter and told the people at the counter which ones I wanted. I was so happy I got my Jons. As I posted the pictures on another post, they have joined their brother and the other Stark pops here at home. Hm… I should find time and do a family reunion picture of the Pops. Now I just need an Iron Throne…

My day was ending early as the only other panel of interest to me per schedule was the 4:00pm Kodansha Comics panel. It’s always fun to sit in on the panel listening in on what interesting manga title they just finished releasing and what stuff is coming out in the next few months that might be of interest. I sat on the panel last year and happily discovered a couple titles that are really great reads that I would recommend. There are a couple titles that sounded promising, but if I actually read them I’ll mention them on here in the future as they haven’t been published in English yet.

At any rate, it was just as well I ended my second day at the con kind of early given the VERY long day ahead of me the next day…

trail.content_raw:
Just like the day before I didn’t really need to get up too early as my first event of the day wasn’t until about 11:30. So as long as I was physically inside the convention center, by around 11am, I was good to go. I just barely made it as I had missed a train and had to wait five minutes for the next train. Then I had to wait a few minutes for the 7 train to get me all the way to the convention center. Anyways I just managed to get inside in time for a SPECIAL thing that I only decided to do about a week before the con…

Why yes… I did pay money to take a picture with David Tennant. Was it expensive? Yes it was. Was it worth the money? I like to think so. After that, I decided to go back to that vendor I discovered the day before to buy my Jon Snow Pops. The line to buy the Pops was very confusing and long. It was so long and the Exhibitors Hall was so crowded, the purchase line had to be cut up into 3 segments to allow crowds to pass through the aisles! I had to wait probably about 15 minutes before I got to the counter and told the people at the counter which ones I wanted. I was so happy I got my Jons. As I posted the pictures on another post, they have joined their brother and the other Stark pops here at home. Hm… I should find time and do a family reunion picture of the Pops. Now I just need an Iron Throne…

My day was ending early as the only other panel of interest to me per schedule was the 4:00pm Kodansha Comics panel. At any rate, it was just as well I ended my second day at the con kind of early given the VERY long day ahead of me the next day…
